sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: The playdone function is used to determine when notes played by the play procedure have finished sounding.
sections.text_content: The playdone function is used to determine when notes played by the play procedure have finished sounding.
sections.mdown_content: The **playdone** function is used to determine when notes played by the **play** procedure have finished sounding.

sections.title: Example
code:
play ( "cde" )
        loop
            exit when playdone
        end loop
        put "All done"
sections.raw_content: This program sounds the first three notes of the C scale and outputs "All done" as soon as they are finished. Without the loop, the message would come out before the notes are finished.
sections.text_content: This program sounds the first three notes of the C scale and outputs "All done" as soon as they are finished. Without the loop, the message would come out before the notes are finished.
sections.mdown_content: This program sounds the first three notes of the C scale and outputs "All done" as soon as they are finished. Without the loop, the message would come out before the notes are finished.

sections.title: Details
sections.raw_content: Under some systems such as UNIX, the playdone procedure may be meaningless.
sections.text_content: Under some systems such as UNIX, the playdone procedure may be meaningless.
sections.mdown_content: Under some systems such as UNIX, the **playdone** procedure may be meaningless.

sections.title: See also
sections.raw_content:
the play procedure. See also the sound procedure which makes a sound of a given frequency (Hertz) and duration (milliseconds).

See also predefined unit Music.
sections.text_content:
the play procedure. See also the sound procedure which makes a sound of a given frequency (Hertz) and duration (milliseconds).
See also predefined unit Music.
sections.mdown_content:
the **[play](play.html)** [procedure](procedure.html). See also the **[sound](sound.html)** [procedure](procedure.html) which makes a [sound](sound.html) of a given frequency (Hertz) and duration (milliseconds).

See also predefined unit **[Music](musicmodule.html)**.
